name: Paola Loreti
content:
Paola Loreti is an Italian mathematician, and a professor of mathematical analysis at Sapienza University of Rome.[1]
She is known for her research on Fourier analysis, control theory, and non-integer representations. The Komornik–Loreti constant, the smallest non-integer base for which the representation of 1 is unique, is named after her and Vilmos Komornik.[2]
 Loreti earned a laurea from Sapienza University in 1984. Her dissertation, Programmazione dinamica ed equazione di Bellman [dynamic programming and the Bellman equation] was supervised by Italo Capuzzo-Dolcetta.[3]
 With Vilmos Komornik, Loreti is the author of the book Fourier Series in Control Theory (Springer, 2005).[4]
raw:
Italian mathematician
Paola Loreti is an Italian mathematician, and a professor of mathematical analysis at Sapienza University of Rome.[1]
She is known for her research on Fourier analysis, control theory, and non-integer representations. The Komornik–Loreti constant, the smallest non-integer base for which the representation of 1 is unique, is named after her and Vilmos Komornik.[2]
Loreti earned a laurea from Sapienza University in 1984. Her dissertation, Programmazione dinamica ed equazione di Bellman [dynamic programming and the Bellman equation] was supervised by Italo Capuzzo-Dolcetta.[3]
With Vilmos Komornik, Loreti is the author of the book Fourier Series in Control Theory (Springer, 2005).[4]
